title: Babysitter caught on nanny cam kicking five-month-old twins and covering their mouths
text:

A monster babysitter who didn't know a family had nanny cam is beginning a 30-day prison sentence after being filmed kicking baby twins she was supposed to be taking care of.

Cruel McKenna Newell also covered their mouths and struck them, a court heard.

She will serve a month behind bars and spend three years on probation after pleading guilty to one count of child abuse in Utah in January.

Judge L. Douglas Hogan also suspended a $5,000 fine.

It came after a A $75,000 warrant was issued for her arrest earlier this year.

Soon after, she turned herself in to West Jordan police, Kiro 7 reports.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

The 21-year-old admitted the abuse after the five-month-old twins' father reported her to police.

The family have not been named but the dad said she kicked, hit and covered the noses and mouths of his daughters.

Police Sergeant JC Holt says the charges came after nanny cam proof was put forward.

He said: "It’s our worst fear as a parent that something like that would happen to your child, especially with somebody you know that you’ve left that child in their care.

"She lost her patience. She didn’t deal with it in a healthy manner. I think that all of us as adults, we can be susceptible to that at times.

"It’s not excusable and it’s not okay, that’s why we handled the case the way that we did."

According to a legal statement, Newell shook the children then ‘used her hand to hit (one of the children) on her legs…(she) also kicked (the child) in the rib/leg area several times.'

Newell is seen in the video "covering their nose and mouth area with her hand," it read.
description: McKenna Newell who was being paid to look after the babies in Salt Lake City, Utah, in January, has been jailed for 30 days
